item.title: In-Progress: Themba Tutors identity & website
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
We're working again with Craig Selinger (of BrooklynLetters.com) on a new project he's starting with his business partner Blythe.

The post In-Progress: Themba Tutors identity & website appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
It’s great to be working again with Craig of Brooklyn Letters (along with his partner Blythe) on his new venture, Themba Tutors. Their network of professional tutors will provide educational services to both kids and adults.

This project is a reunion in a few ways, we’re also teaming up again with the very talented Elisa Lewis on the design and programming!

We’ve just finished defining their identity and we’re working on the site design & programming at the moment, so keep an eye out for the launch!

The post In-Progress: Themba Tutors identity & website appeared first on mimoYmima.

item.title: Dr. Amy Yasko
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
We just finished up the re-design of Dr. Amy Yasko's website. The challenge with this one was to create a warm welcoming introduction for parents to a site that has very complicated scientific subject matter.

The post Dr. Amy Yasko appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
We just finished up the re-design of Dr. Amy Yasko’s website. The challenge with this one was to create a warm welcoming introduction for parents to a site that has very complicated scientific subject matter.

Website Designs

We designed the site to feel like a friendly warm place to learn about the program. We take every opportunity we can to show a photo of a child that’s been helped by her program because that’s what it’s all about.

Patients considering filing suit against their doctors should be sure to consult a Charlotte brain injury lawyers. You can find this center and medical malpractice attorney near you using the search tools below.

Dr Amy has been treating children with autism for years customizing holistic medicine treatments for each child based on specialized tests she’s developed, while using other wellness measures as a recreation and exercise with equipment as a pilates ball so kids become more social. Her old site was too technical though and left most mothers running for the hills.

Logo Concept

Although not chosen by the client, we really liked to buy smokea headshop products concept, the canary was suggested by Amy’s team as a good symbol for her practice because of their sensitivity to foreign substances (something they share with Autistic children).

dramyyasko.com

NOTE: We collaborated with health journalist, Alison Rose Levy on the content for this project.

The post Dr. Amy Yasko appeared first on mimoYmima.

item.title: Paula is the best…
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
The designer needs to be ever present because, inevitably, at some side meeting, something will be suggested that will totally destroy the form of the logo...

The post Paula is the best… appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
The designer needs to be ever present because, inevitably, at some side meeting, something will be suggested that will totally destroy the form of the logo. Something can be suggested innocently, with the best of intentions, that will scuttle all plans, compromise all standards, and destroy the integrity of the design. The only person who can know this and stop this is the designer.

Paula Scher

The post Paula is the best… appeared first on mimoYmima.
